https://api.github.com/repos/grogarden/g.title: stop using the `deploy` branch in the main cwd for `gro deploy`
https://api.github.com/repos/grogarden/g.body:
vscode flips out regularly from the workspace-destructive `deploy` branch in `gro deploy`. This refactors the internals to use a non-destructive strategy, at the cost of inefficiency -- a `.git` directory for the `deploy` branch is now duplicated in a cache directory. A benefit is that you no longer see `deploy` in your root `.git` context.

- maybe `.gro/deploy`?
- `git clone -b deploy --single-branch git://github.com/grogarden/gro.git

https://api.github.com/repos/grogarden/g.title: add `.well-known/src.json` and `.well-known/src/`
https://api.github.com/repos/grogarden/g.body:
- add `.well-known/src.json` and `.well-known/src/` with `modules`
- remove `modules` from `.well-known/package.json`
- docs
- export src_json  from package.ts

I think it makes sense to do, I don't see major downsides, just minor ones:

- slows the build a small amount
- slower to upload and init with more files
- bundle size increases significantly for source text

future

- improve default source filter? filter with gitignore? trace the modules maybe?
